subject: Management
title: The Change Coalition
description: A quick win: understand The Change Coalition.

hook.text: A lone VP tried to drive digital transformation. Without allies, she burned out in eight months.

buildup.text: Change led by one person is fragile. You need a coalition of influential supporters across the org.

discovery.text: Kotter: the coalition needs position power, expertise, credibility, and leadership. Not just seniority.

twist.text: The best coalition members aren't always the obvious executives. They're the informal influencers.

climax.text: Build a diverse coalition: formal and informal leaders, skeptics-turned-believers, and cross-functional reps.

punchline.text: Change is a team sport. Build the team before you start.

quiz.question: What makes an effective change coalition?
options: A diverse mix of formal leaders, informal influencers, and cross-functional representatives
Only the most senior executives in the organization
One strong leader who can drive the change alone
